item.title: [git push -u origin main] Doesn’t Work
item.description: Background: GitHub changed their default branch name from “master” to “main”, but strangely, git push -u origin main doesn’t work on my Mac. git push -u origin masterworks fine, but this command automatically creates an unnecessary “master” branch for me. I want to figure out how to use the git push command to push code to the “main” branch. Solution: I tried “git merge,” but it does not work. The following solution works for me:

item.title: How to Update This Blog
item.description: This blog is built by Hugo and deployed to GitHub Pages. When updating new contents, I use Git pushing everything to the GitHub repository, and here are some memo to myself: #1 Write a post Open cmd, cd to hugo blog local folder. hugo new posts/“new post.md” Open “new post”. Start writing by using a markdown editor (recommended). #2 Preview hugo server -D Make sure everything works fine.

item.title: Switch Between Multiple GitHub Accounts With SSH Keys
item.description: The following are some commands I use frequently when I switch between different GitHub accounts on my Mac. Use the following command to set a default Git account: Git config –global user.name "username1" Git config –global user.email "useremail1" Use the following command to switch to another Git account temporarily. Git config user.name "username1" Git config user.email "useremail1" Use the following command to check what is the current Git account: ssh -T git@github.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hi there! Welcome to my blog. I built this blog for sharing my readings and notes on editing technnical documentations. Hope you find some posts useful. Feel free to get in touch!
